text: El Museo de Tradiciones y Leyendas () is located in León, Nicaragua. The museum building was once the infamous XXI jail where, from 1921 to 1979, many prisoners were tortured. Today, the prison cells depict Nicaraguan traditions and legends through puppet illustration, while wall paintings portray how tortured prisoners suffered. The museum charges an admission fee. A Spanish guided tour is available. == See also == * Museums of Nicaragua == External links == * Museo de Leyendas y Tradiciones information Category:Museums in Nicaragua Category:Prison museums in South America Category:Defunct prisons in Nicaragua Category:León Department
title: Museum of Traditions and Legends
